info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 05 at 1:07PM PST until November 07 at 12:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO MIDNIGHT PST MONDAY NIGHT ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Rain and snow showers expected Monday, changing to all snow showers Monday afternoon and evening. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches above 7000 feet. A dusting to one inch possible for Lake Tahoe and Truckee communities. Winds gusting to 45 mph in valleys with ridge gusts to around 100 mph. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From noon Monday to midnight PST Monday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, delays, and chain controls. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest intensity snow and potential travel impacts are from around 4 PM to 10 PM Monday, after sunset, including the evening commute. Snowfall rates up to 1 inch per hour are possible for periods of time. Donner Pass and Echo Summit could be affected.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
